New Records: Republic of Ireland secured their first win in the Nations League since 2018
Republic of Ireland's first comeback win in a competitive game since 2013
Key Match Events: Republic of Ireland scored twice after trailing 1-0
Robbie Brady scored the 88th-minute winner with an assist from Festy Ebosele
Finland scored first after four passes around the back
Pre-Game Insights: Republic of Ireland were facing relegation fears
Ireland's strategy involved controlling possession and exploiting the defensive third
Manager Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized the need to'stop the bleeding'
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Heimir Hallgrímsson praised the team's resilience
The victory provided a much-needed boost in confidence
Miscellaneous Highlights: Evan Ferguson's disallowed goal was a key moment
Others: The match was part of the Nations League Group 2 League B
